WRITING.TEXT: I found inspiration from Impressionism and there are a lot of different techniques being used. I started with thin layers, scumbling, build up enough layers and then used a palette knife to lay down paint too. I'm continuing to glaze over the layers to add color depth and shine.
Dude, awesome. Those are fuckin incredible!
Thank you! Yes I need render things and tighten up areas of focus
I would sell these for about $600. They are 24"x30" so its a fairly good size.
I appreciate the kind words. Means a lot to hear that after working hard on these. Thank you
wow. Kicking myself for not thinking of that. Thank you

Sea-salt ice cream is a type of ice cream found in Twilight Town and Radiant Garden. It appears throughout the Kingdom Hearts universe, but made its first appearance in Kingdom Hearts II. The ice cream's flavor mixes both a salty taste and a sweet taste.
An interview with Tetsuya Nomura after Kingdom Hearts II explained that Nomura first tasted sea-salt ice cream at a trip to Tokyo DisneySea, a smaller resort of Disney's parks in Japan. He liked the ice cream very much and decided to work with Disney to have it put into Kingdom Hearts II. He also said that the idea to put the dessert into the game came to him when he was thinking about what the kids in Twilight Town do and eat over summer vacation.
WOW THAT WOULD Be AWESOME. Hell yesssss!!

WRITING.TEXT: no problem... ask away. and here if you want to see some of my other work. its very differnt from this. www.ramandipsingh.com
Of course. I'll let you know as soon as I finish it

Funny story. I had a canvas laying around that I had tried to multiple acrylic paintings on. All paintings had failed and I saw it today. I thought well, shit might as well try paint something over abstract chaos. I took burnt umber in oils and just did the outline of sora. Thats the process so far. Everything in the back ground is multiple attempts at different paintings. This is merely the foundation however. I plan to go in and actually build it to a high level of rendering , etc. Going To Tone Down THE Chaos With A light blue layer so all the focus goes on to sora and the line work.
Thanks. This is the first place I'll post as soon as it's done and I'll be selling it too

She's about 90 now. Yeah it's insane what she has witnessed. From going through 1947, to her sons making it america and her even seeing the U.S. It's just so overwhelming and mind-boggling to think about. She has been so many places, and times.
Hire me for..?
Where? She's in india right now, but she's been to the states a couple times

Here's my site: www.ramandipsingh.com
As for info and techniques.. I will be back later to provide you with that. I've been working on this day and night for the last few weeks and finally get to sleep!!! Talk to you in a bit.
yesssss. Mansa, near Bathinda
who are you?!?!!?!?!!?!? please tell me or i'll never be able to stop thinking about it

:,) I don't know where to start. I just uploaded it and ran to the gym to come back to all these beautiful comments. Thank you and everyone else as well for not only viewing my painting, but reading between the wrinkles to understand the anguish, sorrows, and joys that my grandmother must have seen. It's amazing how we can all relate to a portrait of a specific person. The technical/accuracy is only there to provide grounding to the subtle emotion and expression that is being communicated. I've stayed up for the past few weeks day and night to complete this and it feels like the weight has just been lifted. It's my first "finished" painting and I'm so happy to share it with you all. Thank you so much everyone for being a part of this.
Here's the rest of my work if anyone is interested : www.ramandipsingh.com https://www.facebook.com/SinghsCanvas
